alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cherokee, southeastern Loudon, eastern Polk, southern Blount and Monroe Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northeast of Madisonville to 12 miles southeast of Etowah to 11 miles west of Ducktown. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Murphy, Ducktown, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Vonore, Greenback, Tellico Plains, William L. Davenport Refuge and McGee Carson Peninsula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
